data.text:
Fort Wayne Mad Ants (0-2) at Erie Bayhawks (2-0)

- When: Today and Saturday, 7 p.m.

- Where: Erie Insurance Arena

- On the air: WFNN-AM/1330, youtube.com/nbadleague, nba.com/dleague

- Notes: The BayHawks opened the season with a pair of road victories over the Idaho Stampede last weekend, winning 96-88 and 114-95. They started the 2013-14 season with seven straight losses and didn't pick up their second win until Jan. 3. ... Seth Curry led the BayHawks in scoring in both games with 23 and 26 points. ... Drew Crawford had 22 points and nine rebounds in the opener and Daniel Coursey had 10 points and 10 rebounds. ... Peyton Siva had 14 points and 15 assists in Saturday's 114-95 win. Coursey (10 points, 11 rebounds) and John Bohannon (10, 12) also had double-doubles in that game. ... Curry is eighth in the D-League in scoring at 24.5 points per game, and Siva leads the league in assists with 12.0 per game. ... Crawford is tied for sixth in the league in 3-point percentage at 60 percent (6-for-10). ... The BayHawks lead the D-League in rebounding, averaging 58 per game. ... The Mad Ants are the defending D-League champs but dropped their first two games last weekend, losing at home to Sioux Falls (77-70) and Maine (81-80). ... Andre Emmett leads Fort Wayne in scoring at 21 points per game. Emmett, 32, is in his 11th pro season and spent time in the NBA with the Grizzlies in 2004-05 and the Nets in 2012. He was a second-round pick in 2004 by the Seattle SuperSonics out of Texas Tech, where he became the Red Raiders' all-time leading scorer under coach Bobby Knight. ... Ramon Harris averages 11.5 rebounds per game. ... The Mad Ants shot just 34.7 percent in their opening games but blocked 13 shots, including six by 6-foot 9-inch Nigerian-born center Chukwudiebere Maduabum, a former second-round pick by the Lakers in 2011.

-- John Dudley

BAYHAWKS ROSTER

No. Name Pos. Ht. Wt. College

0 Jarvis Williams F 6-6 195 Minnesota State-Mankato

7 Michael Schachtner F 6-8 220 Wisconsin-Green Bay

9 Peyton Siva G 6-1 181 Louisville

11 Drew Crawford G/F 6-5 215 Northwestern

12 Seth Curry G 6-1 180 Duke

21 John Bohannon C 6-11 210 Texas-El Paso

22 Darren White G 6-4 210 Campbell (N.C.) University

30 Daniel Coursey F 6-10 220 Mercer

31 Kadeem Batts F 6-9 245 Providence

32 Lenzelle Smith G 6-4 210 Ohio State

Coach: Bill Peterson

Assistants: Nate Babcock, Anthony Goldwire
